active_learning.discussion_prompt: Compare and contrast IPsec's Transport Mode and Tunnel Mode. In a debate format, argue which is better for site-to-site VPNs versus remote access VPNs, considering security, performance, NAT compatibility, and real-world trade-offs. Reference RFC 4301 and common deployment challenges.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in IPsec Architecture Framework (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > 001_Cryptography > 001_Cryptographic Protocols > 006_003_Network Layer Security Protocols > IPsec Protocol Suite > IPsec Architecture Framework). Use the provided learning objectives, active learning activities, 4-layer scaffolding, and flashcard schema to generate 100 high-quality, spaced-repetition-optimized flashcards. **Core Content Coverage (from RFC 4301, research):** IPsec suite at OSI L3 for confidentiality/integrity/authenticity. Protocols: AH (RFC 4302: integ+auth), ESP (RFC 4303: conf+integ+auth), IKE (RFC 7296: Phase 1 ISAKMP SA, Phase 2 IPsec SA). SAs (unidirectional bundles). Modes: Transport (end-to-end), Tunnel (new header). Prior knowledge: IP networking, crypto basics. Misconceptions: IPsec=only VPNs; AH=confidentiality. **Instructions:** 1. Distribute cards progressively: 25% Layer 1 (foundation recall), 25% Layer 2 (components), 25% Layer 3 (implementation), 25% Layer 4 (integration/higher Bloom's). 2. Span Bloom's objectives evenly, with 20% EVALUATE/CREATE (integrate active learning prompts as scenario cards). 3. Follow flashcard schema exactly: Use specified types; include all required fields (front, back, explanation, bloom_level, layer, distractors for MCQs). 4. Distractors: Strictly follow protocol (misconceptions, partial truths). 5. Active Learning Integration: 10 cards as 'mini-activities' (e.g., debate-style MCQs from discussion; teach-back Q&A from peer teaching; design prompts from problem-solving). 6. Output Format: JSON array of objects, each: {"id":1, "type":"MCQ", "front":"...", "back":"...", "explanation":"... (link to objective/layer/RFC)", "bloom_level":"APPLY", "layer":2, "distractors":["A:wrong1","B:wrong2","C:wrong3"]}. Ensure active recall, no hints on front. Generate now, ensuring university-level pedagogy (Bloom's, scaffolding) and voter consensus (completeness on AH/ESP/IKE/SA, pedagogy enhancements).
